title: How to Design a Rake Utensil Holder

steps.headline: Remove rake handle.
steps.description:
Determine the length of your rake holder and then saw off the handle using an electric saw. Take safety precautions before using the electric saw and make one clean cut at the designated area. Use sandpaper to soften the sawed off edges. Polish with a soft cloth. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/72\/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/72\/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Scrub rake, especially if you are recycling an old rake.
steps.description:
Use liquid dish detergent and hot water to clean the rake. Dry thoroughly before use. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8c\/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8c\/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Identify the area of the rake that can be mounted to the wall.
steps.description:
Most likely the place where the handle began would be ideal. Find a place on the wall that will hold the rake. Consider marking that spot with a pencil. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bb\/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/bb\/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Drill a screw into an area you've marked on the wall.
steps.description:
Drill ¾ of the way into the wall leaving enough room to hold the rake. Hang your utensils or glassware! {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/6e\/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/6e\/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

text:
Remove rake handle. Determine the length of your rake holder and then saw off the handle using an electric saw. Take safety precautions before using the electric saw and make one clean cut at the designated area. Use sandpaper to soften the sawed off edges. Polish with a soft cloth. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Scrub rake, especially if you are recycling an old rake. Use liquid dish detergent and hot water to clean the rake. Dry thoroughly before use. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Identify the area of the rake that can be mounted to the wall. Most likely the place where the handle began would be ideal. Find a place on the wall that will hold the rake. Consider marking that spot with a pencil. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bb/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bb/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Drill a screw into an area you've marked on the wall. Drill ¾ of the way into the wall leaving enough room to hold the rake. Hang your utensils or glassware! {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Design-a-Rake-Utensil-Holder-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"}
